column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: The FY22 Modern Slavery Statement (released in FY23) was to hold a modern slavery training session for Malaysian and international suppliers to build capacity in this area. A webinar was held with over 80 suppliers attending. A post-event survey found that before the webinar, 60% of attendees who completed the survey rated their understanding of modern slavery as limited and 40% as good.
column14: Following the webinar, 70% of attendees rated their understanding good, and 30% rated their knowledge as excellent. All respondents said they understood how Lynas and our suppliers play a role in preventing modern slavery.

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Lynas is a signatory to the United Nations Global Compact. This human rights policy includes protecting human rights and eliminating all forms of forced and compulsory labour as part of its Ten Principles. In FY23, Lynas participated in several U.N. Global Compact education sessions on human rights.

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Supplier Sustainability Policy to mitigate the risks of modern slavery at our operations and in our supply chains, which requires all suppliers to agree to respect the fundamental rights of employees. Lynas assessed the policy for local and international suppliers.

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column8: Health, Safety and Environmental Protection Standard
column13: Health, Safety and Environmental Protection Standards are critical components of any responsible mining and processing operation, and companies often have detailed policies and procedures to ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations. It's crucial to mitigate potential risks and minimize the environmental impact.

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Lynas is unwavering in its stance against conflict minerals, taking a proactive initiative to combat modern slavery and unethical sourcing practices. Through a dedicated commitment to responsible mineral supply chains, Lynas is actively working to ensure that its operations remain free from materials associated with human rights abuses or funding linked to conflicts.

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column7: Lynas is a signatory to the United Nations Global Compact, which includes protecting human rights and eliminating all forms of forced and compulsory labour as part of its Ten Principles. In FY23, Lynas participated in several UN Global Compact education sessions on human rights and the environment.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Laverton Cross Cultural Association (LCCA) is a not-for-profit organization based in Laverton in the Northern Goldfields of W.A. Funded through contributions from several mining companies operating in the region, the LCCA is a partnership between the mining industry, Aboriginal organizations and the Laverton community.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas initiative to make the Shire of Laverton and Lynas employees volunteer for community events and other Shire of Laverton initiatives each year, including Clean Up Laverton Day and Laverfest.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas is assisting the Laverton-based One Tree Laverton Crisis Intervention Service in providing essential services for women and children. $5,000 donations were presented to One Tree Laverton and the Goldfields Women's Health Care Centre at Lynas' inaugural International Women's Day event in Kalgoorlie.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas sponsors the Goldfields Sports Awards and the Central Regional TAFE Vocational Student of the Year award. Sponsorship of community events, including Lorna Mitchell Spring Festival, Christmas in the Park and NAIDOC Youth Ball.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In FY23, Lynas announced a 3-year, $150,000 partnership with the Kalgoorlie-Boulder Urban Landcare Group (KBULG), the premier community environmental organization in Kalgoorlie-Boulder. The partnership will support KBULG programs and initiatives, including the annual tree-planting day, supported by Lynas employee participation in FY23.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas' support for employee memberships and team activities at the Laverton Sports Club and sponsorship of the Laverton Cycling Program is designed to engage Laverton's young people in a fun learning experience.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas provide a scholarship amounting to $55,000, a 5-year commitment to Curtin University's Moorditj Yorga Scholarship to support mature-aged First Nations women to attain an undergraduate degree at Curtin, with priority to be given to women from the Goldfields region.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas Local Giving Program to help meet the needs of grassroots community organizations with $500 donations. To date, 20 organizations have received grants to continue their great work, including Goldfields Giants Women's NBL, Days for Girls, Eastern Goldfields Netball Association, Retirees WA (Coolgardie), Kanyana Wildlife Rehabilitation Centre, Fairbridge College, Goldfields Community Legal Centre, Goldfields Women's Refuge, Boulder City Football Club, Salvation Army Kalgoorlie Boulder, Spartans Basketball Club, and Mines Hockey Club.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas's Annual Back to School Program aims to support underprivileged children within the Company's community. This initiative involves providing uniforms and educational materials, ensuring disadvantaged children have the necessary resources to pursue their education effectively.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column9: Recycling program and free health screening
column13: The Recycling Program reflects Lynas' commitment to environmental stewardship by encouraging the responsible disposal and reuse of materials. Simultaneously, the Free Health Screening initiative underscores Lynas' dedication to community health by providing cost-free health assessments, ensuring that individuals access essential preventive healthcare services.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas Rare Earth demonstrates its commitment to social responsibility by actively contributing to charitable homes. Through various initiatives and donations, Lynas extends support to philanthropic organizations, fostering a positive impact on the lives of those residing in these homes.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas integrates Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) activities into its staff events, showcasing a commitment to community engagement and social impact. These CSR activities are thoughtfully designed to involve Lynas employees in initiatives that contribute positively to society.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Knowledge Transfer Program venture between Lynas and local universities exemplifies a collaborative effort to enhance academic-industry partnerships and foster innovation. This initiative involves the exchange of expertise, research findings, and technical knowledge between Lynas and academic institutions.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas Rare Earth hosts an Annual Sports Carnival, a vibrant and inclusive event that brings together the Kuantan community. In the F.Y. 2023, this carnival garnered enthusiastic participation from over 4,000 community members.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas Rare Earth is proud to sponsor and organize a Football and Futsal Program to promote community engagement and foster a healthy, active lifestyle. This program provides opportunities for individuals of all ages within the local community to participate in football and futsal activities.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas Rare Earth is enthusiastic about promoting recreational activities and community bonding through its Bowling Events Program. This initiative is designed to bring together employees, their families, and local community members for enjoyable and competitive bowling experiences.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Lynas Rare Earth offers a unique opportunity for visitors to gain insight into the Company's operations, environmental practices, and commitment to responsible rare earth production. This program is designed to provide a transparent and educational experience, fostering stakeholder understanding and engagement.

column13: In FY23, Lynas completed corporate cyber security audits and assessments, including third-party network penetration testing, which confirmed compliance with security standards. Regular I.T. audits and cyber security health checks are undertaken with external specialists, and action plans are developed for implementation.
